newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midwest hogs trade steady-down $0.50 - trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midwest hogs trade steady-down $0.50 - trade.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hogs traded steady to $0.50 per cwt lower, with snow restricting hog marketings in some Minnesota markets while flooding blocked roads in southern Ohio, cash dealers said.

Interior Iowa and southern Minnesota dealers said hogs traded steady to $0.50 lower at $48.50 to $49.00 at country points and $49.00 to $49.50 delivered to packing plants versus Monday's practical tops. A few hogs traded Monday at $50.50 but most sold from $49.00 to $50.00 delivered to plants.
Illinois sources reported steady to $0.50 lower trades at $48.50 to $50.00 at country points and $50.00 to $50.50 at plants, sources there said.
Indiana hogs sold $0.50 lower at $49.00 to $49.50 at country points and $50.00 delivered to packing plants.

In southern Ohio, hogs traded steady to higher at $48.00 to $49.00 at country points and $50.00 to $51.00 delivered to packing plants. Hog marketings were light because flooding along the Ohio River blocked roads, Ohio sources said.
